title: 114_hr3869
content: The Act titled "State and Local Cyber Protection Act of 2015" mandates coordination between state and local entities with the National Cybersecurity and Communications Integration Center. The State and Local Cyber Protection Act of 2015 requires the National Cybersecurity and Communications Integration Center to assist State and local governments in identifying information system vulnerabilities and security protections. The National Cybersecurity and Communications Integration Center is mandated to assist State and local governments in enhancing information system security by providing tools, resources, and coordination efforts. The National Cybersecurity and Communications Integration Center offers cybersecurity training, privacy and civil liberties training, and operational assistance to State and local governments to enhance information security. This includes deploying technology for threat mitigation and analyzing data on cyber threats and vulnerabilities. The National Cybersecurity and Communications Integration Center provides cybersecurity training, privacy training, and operational assistance to State and local governments. This includes analyzing data on cyber threats and vulnerabilities, conducting targeted evaluations on information systems, assisting in coordinating vulnerability disclosures, and sharing information security tools and resources developed by the Department and other Federal agencies. The Privacy and civil liberties training provided by the National Cybersecurity and Communications Integration Center includes processes, methods, and information consistent with Fair Information Practice Principles. It aims to limit the receipt, retention, use, and disclosure of cybersecurity-related information not necessary for cybersecurity purposes. The National Cybersecurity and Communications Integration Center aims to minimize privacy and civil liberties impact, ensure data integrity, safeguard sensitive information, protect confidentiality, and observe legal and privacy protections in handling cybersecurity risks and incidents. The National Cybersecurity and Communications Integration Center ensures privacy protections and data integrity in handling cybersecurity risks. Congressional oversight requires reporting on activities and effectiveness to relevant committees after 2 years of enactment. Feedback from State and local governments on the effectiveness of these activities is also sought. The House of Representatives passed the information required under this subsection on December 10, 2015. Attest: KAREN L. HAAS, Clerk.
